item.title: Random Items from an Array
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]you would need to declare it as an Item[] and not an int.

Such as;

[code=Java]THIEF(ID, LEVEL, ANIMATION, DAMAGE, new Item[] {
new Item(ITEM, AMOUNT),
new Item(ITEM, AMOUNT),
new Item(ITEM, AMOUNT)
}, EXP);
public int[] mapLocation = new int[7];

thieve(int id, int level, int animation, int damage, Item[] loot, int exp) {
mapLocation[0] = id;
mapLocation[1] = level;
mapLocation[2] = animation;
mapLocation[3] = damage;
mapLocation[4] = loot[0];
mapLocation[5] = loot[1];
mapLocation[6] = exp;
}
[/code]i don’t think i assigned the array value correctly,[/quote]
Maybe make a two dimensional array with the item and its amount appended to each individual array? I’ll try this out when I get home. On my iPod atm.

Read full topic

item.title: Random Items from an Array
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“baddy351, post:5, topic:399367”]Okay, use I’m pretty sure it’s the miscRandom method, I won’t spoonfeed u ( I can’t i is on iPod) tho for u it might be mathRandom, if u did real java. Then if it’s like u have array a and b, it would be like
If
c.playerAction == (w/e it is fir u);
miscRandom (a)
}else{
if
c.playerAction == (same as b4);
miscRandom (b)

I mean this is a basic idea, I’ll help more when on computer, when get some sleep (right now it’s 2:00 AM) or u could use the miscRandom and include it choosing between either, I am tryin to help, but is no where near comp lol, so sorry, but this should be a good setup. Also, I would have suggested instead of using arrays, u use threads or reflections, but alas that would be a pain in the ass now lol. GL, I’ll help u soon :D[/quote]
Yeah I was thinking about using a multidimensional array, but I figured that would use too much reworking. I’m not sure if you understood me, but I’m trying to make it so when you thieve a master farmer you have the possibility of receiving a variety of seeds, but only one per pickpocket. I was going to go about this by making an array of possible loot from pick-pocketing a master farmer, but I wasn’t sure how to setup how you would receive a seed from that array randomly and where to put it. Here is my Rob class, if that helps you any.

[code=Java]package com.rs2.content.skills.thieving;

import java.util.HashMap;

import com.rs2.content.controllers.Animation;
import com.rs2.content.controllers.AnimationsController;
import com.rs2.content.controllers.DamageController;
import com.rs2.content.controllers.GraphicsController;
import com.rs2.model.Entity;
import com.rs2.model.Entity.CombatType;
import com.rs2.model.combat.content.Life;
import com.rs2.model.npc.NPC;
import com.rs2.model.player.Client;
import com.rs2.model.player.PlayerConstants;
import com.rs2.tiles.FollowEngine;
import com.rs2.tiles.TileManager;
import com.rs2.util.Misc;

/**
*

  • @author Killamess
  • Basic thieving atm

*/

public class Rob {

public static HashMap<Integer, thieve> npcs = new HashMap<Integer, thieve>();

public static int Map(int npcType, int location) {
	return npcs(npcType).mapLocation[location];
}
public static thieve npcs(int id) {
	return npcs.get(id);
}

    int[] seeds = {

    };

public enum thieve {

	MAN1(1, 1, 422, 1, 995, 30, 8),
	MAN2(2, 1, 422, 1, 995, 30, 8),
	MAN3(3, 1, 422, 1, 995, 30, 8),
	WOMAN1(4, 1, 422, 1, 995, 30, 8),
	WOMAN2(5, 1, 422, 1, 995, 30, 8),
	WOMAN3(6, 1, 422, 1, 995, 30, 8),
	FARMER(7, 10, 412, 1, 995, 90, 1),
	GUARD1(9, 40, 412, 3, 995, 450, 1),
	GUARD2(10, 40, 412, 3, 995, 450, 1),
	WARRIOR_WOMEN(15, 25, 412, 2, 995, 300, 1);
	public int[] mapLocation = new int[7];

	thieve(int id, int level, int animation, int damage, int loot, int lootAmount, int exp) {
		mapLocation[0] = id;
		mapLocation[1] = level;
		mapLocation[2] = animation;
		mapLocation[3] = damage;
		mapLocation[4] = loot;
		mapLocation[5] = lootAmount;
                    mapLocation[6] = exp;
	}
} static {
	for (thieve pointer : thieve.values())
		npcs.put(pointer.mapLocation[0x0], pointer);
}

public static void createSituation(Entity robber, Entity victim) {

	if (robber instanceof Client && victim instanceof NPC) {

		final int npcType = ((NPC)victim).getDefinition().getType();

		if (((Client)robber).getStunnedTimer() > 0) {
			return;
		}
		if (robber.isBusy()) {
			return;
		}
		if (!Life.isAlive(victim, robber)) {
			return;
		}
		if (npcs(npcType) == null) {
			return;
		}

		if (npcs(npcType).mapLocation[1] > ((Client)robber).playerLevel[PlayerConstants.THIEVING]) {
			((Client)robber).getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a Thieving level of "+ npcs(npcType).mapLocation[1] + " to steal from "+((NPC)victim).getDefinition().getName()+"s.");
			return;
		}
		Animation.face(robber, victim);

		if (TileManager.calculateDistance(victim, robber) > 1) {
			robber.following = victim;
			FollowEngine.loop(robber);
		}

		int exp = ((NPC)victim).getDefinition().getCombat();

		if (Misc.random(((((Client)robber).playerLevel[PlayerConstants.THIEVING]) - npcs(npcType).mapLocation[1]) + 3) == 1) {

			((Client)robber).setStunnedTimer(17);
			//((NPC)victim).say("What do you think you're doing?!"); //seems to crash the client?
			Animation.face(victim, robber);
			AnimationsController.addNewRequest(victim, Map(npcType, 2), 1);
			DamageController.addNewHit(victim, robber, CombatType.THIEF, Map(npcType, 3), 2);
			GraphicsController.addNewRequest(robber, 80, 1, 2);

		} else {

			((Client)robber).setStunnedTimer(4);
			Animation.createAnimation(robber, 881);
			((Client)robber).getActionSender().sendInventoryItem(Map(npcType, 4), Map(npcType, 5));
			((Client)robber).getActionAssistant().addSkillXP(npcs(npcType).mapLocation[6] * PlayerConstants.SKILL_EXPERIENCE_MULTIPLIER, PlayerConstants.THIEVING);
		}
	}
}

}
[/code]

Read full topic

Will help tomorrow, with a better clue of what u mean. :P[/quote]What I am trying to do is make it so when you pickpocket a master farmer you get a random seed from an array. The current set up I have allows an int for the “loot” you are going to receive. I was wondering if I could make an array of the seeds you will get from master farmers and then whenever you pickpocket one you get a random seed from that array. Is that sufficient or do you need me to paraphrase that?

item.title: Random Items from an Array
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Okay so I have this:

[code]public enum thieve {

	MAN1(1, 1, 422, 1, 995, 30, 8),
	MAN2(2, 1, 422, 1, 995, 30, 8),
	MAN3(3, 1, 422, 1, 995, 30, 8),
	WOMAN1(4, 1, 422, 1, 995, 30, 8),
	WOMAN2(5, 1, 422, 1, 995, 30, 8),
	WOMAN3(6, 1, 422, 1, 995, 30, 8),
	FARMER(7, 10, 412, 1, 995, 90, 1),
	GUARD1(9, 40, 412, 3, 995, 450, 1),
	GUARD2(10, 40, 412, 3, 995, 450, 1),
	WARRIOR_WOMEN(15, 25, 412, 2, 995, 300, 1);
	public int[] mapLocation = new int[7];

	thieve(int id, int level, int animation, int damage, int loot, int lootAmount, int exp) {
		mapLocation[0] = id;
		mapLocation[1] = level;
		mapLocation[2] = animation;
		mapLocation[3] = damage;
		mapLocation[4] = loot;
		mapLocation[5] = lootAmount;
                    mapLocation[6] = exp;
	}
}[/code]

And I was wondering if I could create an array of items for the loot of an npc. Except I wasn’t exactly sure how I would go about doing this. I know I would have to make say

int[] seeds = { numbers, numbers, numbers, blah, blah, blah };

I was thinking something along the lines of misc.Random(seeds.length) == i;
Then make it loop through the array with i somehow? That’s the part I’m not really sure on how to do. Or maybe I’m going about it the wrong way, anyways, what I was going to do with this was make it so that you got multiple items from thieving that certain npc. A lot easier than adding

thieve(int id, int level, int animation, int damage, int loot, int lootAmount, int loot1, int lootAmount1, ect… int exp) {

would take up too much space and be repetitive. Also, I have like 9 npcs that all receive the same animations and such, just different npc ids. Surely there is a more efficient way than adding 9 different npcs all with the same data, besides int id? I guess I could possible do the same thing?

Read full topic
